result.execSummary:
The defendant Zackary J Hendrix was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail of $250.00 applied to restitution. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
Cash bail of $250.00 applied to Extradition Costs of $457.00.  Balance of costs and DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with the victim or her household. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours Release for standard condition. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Exhibit 1 from Sentencing hearing held 12/1/15 - Destroyed pursuant to statute.
Letter from SPD
Exhibit 1
Invoice for extradition

Stipulation and Order for Return of Exhibits signed and filed.  Exhibits shall be disposed of pursuant to the signed Stipulation and Order and based on the retention period for exhibits in SCR 72.01(46).  Biological material collected in connection with the action shall be disposed of pursuant to the retention period for exhibits in section 757.54, Wis. Stats.

Defendant Zackary J Hendrix in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing and restitution hearing.  Recommendations by the State.  Statement by S.M.  Recommendations by the defense.  Court will address restitution at this time.  S.M. sworn in and testified.  Exhibit 1 marked.  A.M. sworn in and testified.  Court declares testimony and evidence closed.  

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 2 years 6 months (Initial Confinement: 1 year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 1 year) STAYED
- 2 years Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- Cash bail to be applied as follows: $250.00 to Restitution; $250.00 to Extradition costs
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Restitution of $885.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation to S.M.
- Extradition costs of $457.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Continue with AODA treatment/counseling.  No contact with victim or her household.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.

CONDITION TIME: 60 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED for use by Agent.
